Replies.Reply: Another!
Have you ever known me to be nervous?
That wasn't nerves, brother. It was the rage of battle. How else could I have fought my way through a hundred warriors and pulled us out alive?
Some do battle, others just do tricks.
Now that was just a waste of good wine.
You don't really want to start this again, do you, Cow?
You're incapable of sincerity.
Thank you.
Stop.
How do I look?
You go ahead.
I'll be along. Go on.
Why does everyone keep saying that?
And what is that?
I swear.
I swear.
I swear.
The Jotuns must pay for what they've done!
I want to know why they--
And if you hadn't taken it from them they would have laid waste to all the Nine Realms!
He just broke your truce! We must act!
March into Jotunheim as you once did, teach them a lesson, break their spirits so they'll never dare try to cross our borders again!
This was an act of war!
They got this far!
As King of Asgard, I would--
It's unwise to be in my company right now, brother.
This was to be my day of triumph.
Yes, exactly!
It's the only way to ensure the safety of our borders.
The safety of our Realm is no jest.
My father fought his way into Jotunheim, defeated their armies, and took their Casket! We'd just be looking for answers.
My friends, have you forgotten all that we've done together?
Who brought you into the sweet embrace of the most exotic maidens in all of Yggdrasil?
And who proved wrong all who scoffed at the idea that a young maiden could be one of the fiercest warriors this Realm has ever known?
My friends, trust me now. We must do this.
Come on. You're not going to let my brother and me take all the glory, are you?
We must first find a way to get past Heimdall.
Enough.
Heimdall, may we pass?
Then tell no one where we've gone until we've returned.
I have no plans to die today.
Come on. Don't be bashful.
Too late now.
For what?
We know all we must. It's time to act.
It feels good, doesn't it? To be together again, adventuring on another world?
What would you call it?
How about a song to lift our spirits?
Hiding. As cowards always do.
I speak only to your King. Not to his foot soldiers.
And I am--
I demand answers.
How did your people get into Asgard?
Do not dishonor my father's name with your lies.
Not when you'd use it to make war against other Realms.
This boy has grown tired of your mockery.
Next!
Come on! At least make it a challenge for me!
Now that's more like it!
Ugly and stupid.
Come on!
Then go!
I can stop them!
Loki, we have to see.
Now! We'll finish them together!
Why did you bring us back?
I was protecting my home.
There won't be a kingdom to protect if you're afraid to act!
Whatever the cost, the world must know that the new King of Asgard will not be held in contempt.
While you wait and be patient, the Nine Realms laugh at us! The old ways are done. You'd stand giving speeches while Asgard falls!
And you are an old man and a fool!
Father! Heimdall! I know you can hear me! Open the bridge!
You! What world is this?
Where am I?! Answer me!
What Realm?! Alfheim? Nornheim?
How dare you attack the son of Odin!
Then bring me a healing stone, you savages!
You're no match for the Mighty--
It's not possible.
They will suffice.
What does anyone do in the Bifrost?
This mortal form has grown weak.
This drink. I like it.
Another!
It was delicious. I want another.
I just did.
I meant no disrespect.
You have my word.
Where?!
Twelve miles east of here.
To get what belongs to me.
It's not what they say it is.
Yes.
If you take me there now, I'll tell you everything you wish to know.
All the answers you seek will be yours, once I reclaim Mjolnir.
I understand. Then this is where we say goodbye.
I need a horse.
Then give me one of those, large enough to ride.
Many times. You're brave to do it.
But you're clever. Far more clever than anyone else in this Realm.
You think me strange?
Good strange or bad strange?
You'll see soon enough.
What you seek -- it's a bridge.
More like a rainbow bridge.
You're going to need this.
Stay here. Once I have Mjolnir, I will return what they stole from you.
Deal?
No.
I'm going to fly out.
You're big.
Fought bigger.
Just a man.
Loki? What are you doing here?
What?
Can I come home?
But couldn't we find a way to--
Good-bye.
Where are we going?
Thank you for what you've done.
Are you in love with her?
Neither did I.
I swear to you, I mean her no harm.
I had it all backwards. I had it all wrong.
I have no quarrel with you. But she's a lady. You should be more respectful.
Standing there with the unconscious Selvig slung over his shoulder.
He's fine. Not injured at all.
Sorry, my friend.
We drank. We fought. He made his ancestors proud.
These are your chambers?
You've been very kind. I've been far less grateful than you deserve.
It was all I could get back. Not as much as I promised. I'm sorry.
What's wrong?
You must do this. You must finish what you've started.
Because you're right. It's taken so many generations for your people to get to this point. You're nearly there. You just need someone to show you how close you really are.
Look -- your ancestors called it magic. You call it science. I come from a place where they're one and the same thing.
You're very welcome.
May I have this?
Thank you. Excuse me a moment.
To replace the one I broke. Please forgive my behavior.
My friends!
My friends, I've never been happier to see anyone. But you should not have come.
You know I can't. My father is dead because of me. I must remain in exile.
Leave this town now. Get yourself and your friends to safety.
I must stay and fight.
I'm still a warrior, and I will fight by your side.
You're right.
Help me clear the streets. I'll let none of these people die this day.
My friends fight bravely, but they won't be able to hold it back much longer.
Go, while you can!
You can't help them now. Your job is to survive.
Live and tell those stories yourself.
Get him out of here!
But not win. Move Volstagg, or he'll die!
Don't worry, my friends. I have a plan.
Take my life, and know I will never return to Asgard.
Heimdall! Open the Bifrost!
He would open it if he could. I fear the worst.
Heimdall!
Know this, son of Coul. You and I, we fight for the same cause -- the protection of this world. From this day forward, count me as your ally.
If you return the items you have stolen from Jane Foster.
Whatever fate lies before me, you are part of it.
Get him to the healing room! Leave my brother to me.
No thanks to you.
Why don't you tell her? How you sent the Destroyer to kill our friends? To kill me?
You're a talented liar, brother.
Why have you done this?
He won't! You can't kill an entire race!
I've changed.
Is the throne really worth what you've done? What you would become?
I will not fight you, brother.
Yet still not clever enough.
Forgive me.
No!
There will never be a wiser king than you. Or a better father.
I have much to learn. I know that now. But some day, perhaps, I will make you proud.
Can you see her?
How is she?
Hurry!
Oh-- watch your head.
It's a little different each time.
Hey, Darcy. Pass up the bubbly and my gloves, will you?
Not until you see it!
Thank you.
The benefit of the doubt.
It's never taken this long before.
Worried, Jane heads back down into the vehicle.
The anomalies are always precipitated by geomagnetic storms.
What?!
Holy. Shatner.
No-- yes! Let's go!
Isn't this great?!
You're seeing it too, right? I'm not crazy?
You've gotta get us closer so I can take a magnetic reading.
You want those college credits or not?
What are you doing?!
Get the first aid kit.
Come on, big guy. Do me a favor and don't be dead, okay? Open your eyes and look at me.
--are dilating. That's a good sign.
After we get a reading on the storm?
Where did he come from?
Get the first aid kit.
Come on, big guy. Do me a favor and don't be dead, okay? Open your eyes and look at me.
Where did he come from?
Uh, thanks. Are you okay?
We've got to move fast before anything changes.
4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 37.
We need soil samples, light readings, everything.
Not right now. It'll take too long. County's an hour away.
Look at him, he's fine.
Okay, you and Darcy take him to the hospital, I'll stay here.
The Nurse painstakingly types it into the computer, one key at a time. Jane watches as Thor is wheeled out of the room.
I've never met him before.
Grazed him, actually.
Oh, and we tasered him, too.
I told you, I don't know him. I just want to make sure he's okay.
Jane Foster.
Darcy, when you're done, take the soil samples to Professor Meyers in geology. Remind him, he owes me.
You know what would be really useful? Do you still have that friend at LIGO?
Could you call in a favor?
If I'm right, their observatory must have picked up gravitational waves during last night's event.
Meaning these anomalies might signify something bigger.
I think the lensing around the edges is characteristic of an Einstein-Rosen Bridge.
She was the only applicant.
A wormhole.
What do you see here?
Yes. But not our stars.
I think I left something at the hospital.
I meant I barely know him anymore.
Typical. I just lost my most important piece of evidence.
We find him.
I want to know what that thing was, and he may have the answers. We don't have a choice.
However long it takes.
I'm so sorry. I swear I'm not doing that on purpose.
Let's get you some clothes.
My ex.
They're the only clothes I had that'll fit you. Sorry.
What were you doing, in that?
What exactly is the Bifrost?
Somebody get the mortal a Pop-Tart.
Now tell us exactly what happened to you last night.
Maybe start with how you got inside that cloud.
Sorry, Izzy. Little accident.
Yo voy a pagar la taza.
What was that?
Then you should just say so!
I mean ask for it. Nicely.
All right, then no more smashing, deal?
Good.
Excuse me, did you say there was a satellite crash?
Where are you going?
Why?
So now you own a satellite?
Whatever it is, the government seems to think it's theirs. You intend to just walk in there and take it?
Everything?
You know what we saw last night.
He's promised us answers.
I'd just be driving him out there, that's all.
I'm sorry. I can't take you.
Hey! That's my stuff!
What the hell is going on here?!
I don't care who you work for, you can't do this!
Let it go?! This is my life!
Instead of answering, Coulson gives her a check.
I can't just pick up replacements from RadioShack! I made most of that equipment myself!
And I'm sure I can sue you for violating my constitutional rights!
Everything I know about this phenomenon is in this lab and in this book, and no one has the right to take it from me.
Years of research, gone.
Look around! They took our back-
Will you please stop talking about your iPod?!
Who are these people?
I'm not going to let them do this.
You still want a lift?
I've never done anything like this before! Have you ever done anything like this before?
They just stole my entire life's work. I really don't have anything left to lose.
that?
Yeah. Just a little.
I'm not quite sure yet.
Sorry.
Who are you? Really?
You promised me answers.
A bridge? Like an Einstein-Rosen Bridge?
God, I hope you're not crazy.
That isn't a satellite crash. They would have hauled the wreckage away, not built a city around it.
Why?--
No! Look what's down there! You can't just walk in, grab our stuff, and walk out!
Erik, okay, first of all, don't worry. I'm perfectly fine, really.
But if you don't hear from me again, you might want to come out to the crater site and look for me.
I can't just leave him there.
You didn't see what happened.
Where did you find this?
Aren't you the one who's always told me to chase down all leads, all possibilities?
Magic's just science we don't understand yet. Arthur C. Clarke.
The precursor of science fact.
If that's really an Einstein-Rosen Bridge out there, then there's something on the other side.
4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 70A.
Advanced beings could have come through it before.
Yes! Exactly! Thank you!
Erik!
Is he all right?
What happened?
Put him on the bed.
Well, it's more of a temporary living space, really. I don't usually have visitors in here.
Can we go outside?
I come up here sometimes when I can't sleep. Or when I'm trying to reconcile particle data. Or when Darcy's driving me crazy.
I come up here a lot, now that I think about it.
I'm glad you're safe.
I also hit you with my car a couple times, so it kind of evens out.
SHIELD, whatever they are. They're never going to let this research see the light of day.
Why?
What is it?
What about you?
Erik!
What are you doing? What is that?
Oh. My. God.
Something's wrong.
It's gone.
Thanks.
of yours supposed to look like?
said you should have been a poet.
I recognize those. Think how proud he'd be to see you now.
For what?
That's debateable. Put your seat belt on!
We still have to get him to a hospital.
Immediately, Jane.
Jane, we need get him to a hospital.
You expect me to leave you alone in the middle of the desert?
It's all right, my friend. We're going to get you some help.
You're in the desert outside the town of Puente Antiguo.
Next time you decide to taser someone, do me a favor and make sure they're already inside the truck.
Here. Let's go.
We might want to perform a spectral analysis.
I flew all the way out here --
She was more than a friend.
You don't think this was just a magnetic storm?
Meaning?
Jane indicates the footage on the monitor. As the last of the Bifrost cloud disappears into the night sky, there appears to be a blister in space, bulging out in convex and covered with stars.
I thought you were a science major.
two different points of space-time.
Stars.
Did you see what he did in there?
So we're just going to spend the rest of the day looking for him?
What did the satellite look like?
Jane.
Please don't do this.
I'm not talking about the crater.
grew up with as a child!
It's dangerous. He's dangerous.
Jane. This is more serious than you realize. Let it go.
And your back-ups?
No one knows much about them. But I knew a scientist -- a pioneer in gamma radiation. SHIELD showed up, and he was never heard from again.
Please, let me contact one of my colleagues. Dr. Pym has had some dealings with these people. I'll e-
I'll just be a minute.
Why not?
In the children's section. I wanted to show you how ridiculous his story was.
I was talking about science, not magic!
Who wrote science fiction.
In some cases.
Jane, if you do this, you'll find yourself in a situation that I won't be able to get you out of this time.
Doctor Donald Blake. He's part of our team.
Troubled, not dangerous. He was distraught when he found out that you'd taken all of our research.
Certainly.
Steroids. He's a bit of a fitness nut.
He is. That is, he was. He switched careers and became a physicist. He's quite brilliant, really.
If you would just release him to me, I promise to keep an eye on him.
Thank you.
Donny, Donny, Donny! There you are!
It's going to be all right, my friend. Come on, I'm taking you home.
I will!
To get a drink.
Seems Darcy's a terrible intern, but a talented hacker.
Don't thank me. I only did it for Jane.
Of course not! Jane's like a daughter to me. Her father and I taught at University together. A good man, but he never listened.
I don't know if you're really delusional, and I really don't care at this point. I just care about her. I've seen the way she looks at you.
Good. If that's the case, then I'll buy you one more drink, and you'll leave town tonight. A long pause, then Thor nods. He takes a drink.
It's not a bad thing, finding out that you don't have all the answers. That's when you start asking the right questions.
Anyone who's ever going to find their way in this world has to start by admitting they don't know where the hell they are.
Gentlemen, please. Let's keep our heads. Just then, Selvig HEAD-BUTTS the Townie, knocking him out.
Another drink?
I still don't believe you're the God of Thunder.
But you ought to be.
I need some coffee.
Go! Leave me!
I'm really starting to like him.
Jane, no!
Jane?
Can I turn on the radio?
Jane?
Jane?
I think you want to see this.
Yeah, right! Good one!
Keep the credits. I'll intern at Burger King.
Saving our lives!
I think that was legally your fault.
Wow. Does he need CPR? Because I know CPR.
--are beautiful.
I think that was legally your fault.
Wow. Does he need CPR? Because I know CPR.
Yeah, we can tell you're hammered.
What? He was freaking me out.
Until she hit him with the car.
A what?
Political Science.
Hey, check it out.
So now what?
Oo-kay.
I think you may have hit him with the car one time too many.
You know, for a crazy homeless guy, he's pretty cut.
Hey, sorry I tased you!
And how you could eat an entire box of Pop-Tarts and still be this hungry.
Yeah, it's great, isn't it?
Oh my God, this is going on Facebook.
Smile!
They even took my iPod.
I just downloaded, like, thirty songs on there.
They took your laptop, too.
Hey! Myeu-muh!
A primitive culture like the Vikings might have worshipped them as deities.
I'll help you.
Thanks.
Sure.
Who are they?
Was somebody else coming?
So, how can you speak our language?
No.
Here you go.
He would have come back if he could.
Churn in the sky. The three stare, dumbfounded.
Suffuse with the strange rainbow light, ROARING like a thousand freight trains as it touches down.
4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 5.
Questions, they've always asked questions -- this race called man, on this planet they call earth.
You're not dressed warmly enough.
The freezing cold of Jotunheim. It will kill you all in time, even Thor.
You think you can deceive me? I, who watch all? I, who can sense the flapping of a butterfly's wings a thousand worlds away?
Or can hear a cricket passing gas in Niffelheim?
For ages have I guarded Asgard and kept it safe from those who would do it harm. In all that time, never has an enemy slipped by my watch -- until this day. I wish to know how that happened.
Be warned. I will honor my sworn oath to protect this Realm as its Gatekeeper. If your return threatens the safety of Asgard, Bifrost will remain closed to you.
None do.
All is ready. You may pass.
To keep this bridge open would unleash the full power of the Bifrost and destroy Jotunheim with you upon it.
I turned my gaze upon you in Jotunheim, but could neither see nor hear you. You were shrouded from me, like the Frost Giants who entered this Realm.
Or perhaps someone has found a way to hide that which he does not wish me to see.
No.
Because he is my King, and I am sworn to obey him.
Yes.
You would defy the commands of Loki our King, break every oath you have taken as warriors, and commit treason to bring Thor back?
Good.
I am bound by honor to our King. I cannot open the Bifrost to you.
Tell me, Loki, how did you get the Jotuns into Asgard?
Then I need no longer obey you.
Yes.
4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 7.
Stares out at his kingdom. The ravens fly up to the balcony, land at his side.
Astride his powerful, eight-legged steed SLEIPNIR. He's clad in battle armor, Gungnir in his hand -- an imposing sight.
Standing on the edge of the broken Bridge, awakened from the Odinsleep, restored to his full strength.
Do you think he's ready?
He'll need his father's wisdom.
I've destroyed demons and monsters, devastated whole worlds, laid waste to mighty kingdoms, and still you worry for me?
4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 12A.

Gungnir. Its aim is true, its power strong. With it I have defended Asgard and the lives of the innocent across the Nine Realms since the time of the Great Beginning. And though the day has come for a new King to wield his own weapon -- that duty remains the same. Thor Odinson, my heir, my first-born.
4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 13A.

So long entrusted with this mighty hammer, Mjolnir. Forged in the heart of a dying star, from the sacred metal of Uru. Only one may lift it. Only one is worthy. Who wields this hammer commands the lightning and the storm. Its power has no equal -- as a weapon, to destroy, or as a tool, to build.

Today I entrust you with the greatest honor in all the Nine Realms. The sacred throne of Asgard. I have sacrificed much to achieve peace. So, too, must a new generation sacrifice to maintain that peace. Responsibility, duty, honor. These are not merely virtues to which we must aspire.
Thor Odinson, do you swear to guard the Nine Realms?
Do you swear to preserve the peace?
Do you swear to cast aside all selfish ambition and pledge yourself only to the good of all the Realms?
Then on this day, I, Odin Allfather, proclaim you--
They have paid with their lives.
But they didn't.
The Casket of Ancient Winters belonged to the Jotuns. They believe it's their birthright.
I have a truce with Laufey, the Jotun King.
Leave us.
And what action would you take?
You're thinking only as a warrior!
It was the act of but a few, doomed to fail.
We will find the breach in our defenses. It will be found, and it will be sealed.
You are not King. Not yet.
Laufey. End this.
You're right. These are the actions of a boy. Treat them as such. You and I can stop this before there's further bloodshed.
So be it.
Silence!
Do you realize what you've done?
You cannot protect your friends.
Get him to the healing room!
That's pride and vanity that talks!
You're a vain, greedy, cruel boy!
A fool, yes! I was a fool to think you were ready.
I cast you out!
Whosoever holds this hammer, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Thor.
Do you understand what he set in motion? He's taken us to the brink of war!
What would you have done?
That is why I'm King.
I, too, grieve the loss of our son.
No. His fate is in his own hands now.
Stop!
No. Put the Casket down.
You're my son.
No.
In the aftermath of the battle, I went into the Temple, and I found a baby. Small for a giant's offspring -- abandoned, suffering, left to die. Laufey's son.
You were an innocent child.
Why do you twist my words?
You are my son. My blood. I wanted only to protect you from the truth.
Listen to me!
Loki!
It is over.
You'll be a wise King.
You've already made me proud.
He thinks he is. He has his father's confidence.
And his humility?
Thor won't be alone. Loki will be at his side to give him counsel.
For once, our son needs something we cannot provide.
No. You've put it off too long! I worry for you.
Always.
It's all right to be nervous.
Thor, just remember that you have something even the great Allfather never had.
Me for a mother.
Now don't keep your father waiting.
How could you have done this?
But banishment? You would lose him forever? He's your son!
I would not have exiled him to a world of mortals, stripped of his powers, to suffer alone. I would not have had the heart for such cruelty!
You can bring him back.
I asked him to be honest with you from the beginning. There should be no secrets in a family.
He kept the truth from you so that you would never feel different.
You can speak to him. He can see and hear us, even now.
I don't know. This time is different. We were unprepared.
You're a good son.
We mustn't lose hope that your father will return to us. And your brother.
There's always a purpose to everything your father does. Thor may yet find a way home.
Thor is banished. The line of succession falls to you. Until he awakens, Asgard is yours.
Make your father proud.
Standing behind him -- the sword stuck in his back. She looks to Loki, takes him in her arms.
Thor!
What?
Thank you, Sif.
How is he?
He will need his friends now more than ever.
Nervous, brother?
As I recall, I was the one who veiled us in smoke to ease our escape.
Just a bit of fun.
Right, my friend?
Nice feathers.
I was being sincere!
Am I?
I've looked forward to this day as long as you have. You're my brother and my friend. Sometimes I'm envious, but never doubt that I love you.
Give us a kiss.
Like a king.
It's time.
He said he'd be along.
I wouldn't worry. Father will forgive him. He always does.
Who said I was wise?
It will come. In time.
If it's any consolation, I think you're right. About the Frost Giants, about Laufey, everything.
But there's nothing we can do without defying Father.
It's madness!
Nothing! Thor was making a jest!
What?
Yes, of course! I won't let my brother march into Jotunheim alone.
Keep your weapons sheathed and your mouths closed. This is going to take subtlety and sincerity, not brute strength. Leave it to me.
I'm sorry?
You must be mistaken. We're not--
Get me off this bridge before it cracks under your girth.
Perhaps we should wait.
To survey the enemy. To gauge their strengths and weaknesses from a distance.
Thor, stop and think. Look around you. We are outnumbered.
We will accept your most gracious offer.
Damn.
Pathetic.
That can't be good.
Thor, we must go!
Likely killed us all!
I told him.
I told him to go to Odin after we'd left. Though he should be flogged for taking so long.
I saved our lives! And Thor's. I had no idea Father would banish him for what he did.

And if I do, then what? I love Thor more dearly than any of you, but you know what he is. He's arrogant. He's reckless. He's dangerous. You saw how he was today. Is that what Asgard needs from its King?
Am I cursed?
What am I?
What more than that?
The Casket wasn't the only thing you took from Jotunheim that day, was it?
Why? You were knee-deep in Jotun blood. Why would you take me?
You took me for a purpose, what was it?
Tell me!
So I am no more than another stolen relic, locked up here until you might have use of me.
You could have told me what I was from the beginning. Why didn't you?
Because I am the monster parents tell their children about at night?
It all makes sense now. Why you favored Thor all these years.
have a Frost Giant sitting on the Throne of Asgard!
Guards!
So why did he lie?
How long will it last?
I never get used to seeing him like this. The most powerful being in the Nine Realms lying helpless until his body is restored.
What hope is there for Thor?
Sitting sprawled upon his father's throne. He wears his horned ceremonial headdress and holds GUNGNIR in his hand.
Father's fallen into the Odinsleep.
King.
My first command can not be to undo the Allfather's last. We're on the brink of war with Jotunheim. Our people must have a sense of continuity in order to feel safe in these difficult times.
All of us must stand together, for the good of Asgard.
I thought he'd never leave.
I had to see you.
Father is dead.
Your banishment, the threat of a new war, it was too much for him to bear.
You mustn't blame yourself. I know that you loved him. I tried to tell him so, but he wouldn't listen.
4th BLUE REVISIONS 03-26-10 73.
It was cruel to put the hammer within your reach, knowing you could never lift it.
The burden of the throne has fallen to me now.
The truce with Jotunheim is conditional upon your exile.
Mother has forbidden your return.
This is goodbye, brother. I'm so sorry.
Nothing could have stopped me.
Fare well, brother.
I've come alone and unarmed.
To make you another proposition.
You're welcome.
You have no idea what I am.
Hello, Father.
No longer weak. I now rule Asgard, until Odin awakens. Perhaps you should not have so carelessly abandoned me.

Thank you, love.
